title: API V2: Continent Floor ID's Inconsistent

comments.author: Thuron.5648
comments.body: It works like a charm! Thank you for the quick fix

comments.author: Lawton Campbell.8517
comments.body: This should now be fixed on live.

comments.author: Thuron.5648
comments.body: No worries! It’s easy to work around for now. Thank you for the quick update! (And for all the work on the API really, you guys are allowing us gamer/programmers to do such cool things with these API’s, I really appreciate it!)

comments.author: Lawton Campbell.8517
comments.body: Yeah, that’s totally broken. Sorry about that. I’ll try to push the fix to live on Monday :<

comments.author: Thuron.5648
comments.body:
The floors returned by the continents API seem to be inconsistent:

When requesting https://api.guildwars2.com/v2/continents/2, the object returned contains a floor array with the floor ID’s identical to how the v1 array would return them; numbers are skipped and they can be negative.

However when requesting https://api.guildwars2.com/v2/continents/2/floors a whole different array is returned that is in logical order. This is also the only one that can be used to get detailed info about floors in the v2 api.

This is the case with both continents.
